nodes.text: Which part would you like to extract?

steps.action: Locate the hard drive bay inside the case.
Unscrew or unlatch the HDD mount.
Unplug SATA power and data cables.
Slide the HDD out carefully.
Identify the SSD mount (2.5" bay or M.2 slot).
For 2.5", unplug SATA power and data cables. For M.2, remove screw.
Gently pull out the SSD.
Remove all connected components first (PSU, motherboard, drives).
Unscrew external panels, feet, and accessories if needed.
Disassemble case parts for recycling or reuse.
Locate the CMOS battery on the motherboard.
Use a plastic tool or fingernail to gently pop it out.
Unplug the fan cable connected to the motherboard.
Unscrew or unlatch the cooler mounting mechanism.
Twist gently and lift off the cooler from the CPU.
Remove the CPU cooler first.
Release the CPU socket latch/lever.
Lift the CPU carefully from the socket, avoiding bending pins.
Locate the case fan(s).
Unplug the fan's power cable from the motherboard or PSU.
Unscrew the fan from the case frame.
Unscrew the GPU from the case bracket.
Unplug any auxiliary power connectors.
Press the PCIe slot release clip and pull the GPU out carefully.
Disconnect all cables (power, data, front panel connectors).
Unscrew all standoffs securing the motherboard.
Lift the motherboard straight out from the case.
Unplug all PSU cables connected to components.
Unscrew the PSU from the case (usually 4 screws at the rear).
Slide the PSU out carefully.
Press down the latches at each end of the RAM slot.
The RAM module will pop up; pull it out at an angle.
